reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a really nice experience - the Moroccan theme of the hotel is a unique one, and the loft-style club rooms are decently sized. As mentioned in previous reviews the honeymoon suite has a great outdoor tub with views of green hills and the sea in the distance (though the overly red theme of the room is a little jarring). The staff were very accomodating and the limited English is not really an issue.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the spacious rooms and the theme
Could Have Been Beta!
reviews.text: A couple of problems though... we had a small hiccup in our reservations (which was quickly sorted). Beds are hard (but typically Thai I understand). And be prepared for minor annoyances with insects.

reviews.title: Unreliable owner, don't go there
reviews.text: Apart from that, Ao Nang is the hub for activity, shopping and food, but if its beaches you're looking for definitely check out Railay or Phra Nang cave beach (a longtail away), these are spectacular.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros - Friendly staff although they couldn't get the on-demand dvd to work
reviews.title: Alis, Schmalis...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -You can choose from their library of DVDs and they will show it on a feed that connects to the TV in your room, it's like on-demand pay per view but you don't need to pay for it
reviews.title: Great Place

likes.disliked: — Mosquitos and little effort to try and reduce them !

reviews.text: -Nice hotel taxi driver, even stopped for us to take a look at a big buddha in a cave on the way to the airport
reviews.title: Alis in Ao Nang

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Very short walking distance to main road with restaurants etc.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: Cons - infinity pool overlooks the street and the hotel on the opposite side of the road,
reviews.title: Terrible

reviews.text: I love this hotel very much!!!!!!
reviews.title: I love Alis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything is nice.....especially the bathtub on the top of my room, very beautiful view, you can see both the mountain and the see(perfect!!!!). As the previous comment said " hotel for the young" he hotel has no lift, but it's the best way to exercise. My friends and i recommend this hotel....you shouldn't miss it
reviews.title: Hotel for the young

reviews.text: Very unique admosphere. The hotel has its own style in making me feel at rest. I like the way they design their room and the way they put small details in all corners.
reviews.title: A great little hotel with pretty rooms

reviews.text: This is a hotel for the young, i can say. Though still need some improvement in service quality, i see the owner's intention t o correct such matters.
reviews.title: Not Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 10 of us travelled to Krabi and chose to stay at the Alis Hotel from 14-17 April after extensive research on the internet. I can't say for the rest but I thought I had a very enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Our worst nightmare in Thailand

likes.liked: — We didn't experience much - the breakfast was OK
likes.disliked: — Terrible service, terrible front desk, total incompetence with internet booking
